HAL shares soar as Cabinet clears Rs 26,000 crore order. Check target priceThe order is expected to boost HAL's order backlog from Rs 94,000 crore to Rs 1.2 lakh crore, providing strong revenue visibility, according to a report by Antique Stock Broking.

GST panel recommends tax relief for foreign airlinesThis proposal follows extensive deliberations by the fitment committee and could offer substantial relief to foreign airlines currently facing tax demands from the Directorate General of GST Intelligence (DGGI).

No salary paid to Madhabi Buch after retirement: ICICI Bank on Congress's claimMadhabi Buch served as the CEO of ICICI Securities from February 2009 to May 2011. In a statement, the bank said it has not paid any salary or granted any ESOPs to Buch after her retirement, other than her retiral benefits.

RBI: 97.96% of Rs 2,000 notes withdrawn, Rs 7,261 crore yet to returnAs of August 30, 2024, only Rs 7,261 crore worth of these notes remain with the public, according to the data released by RBI on Monday.

IndiGo's gender-specific seating for women travellers sees 60-70% rise in AugustIndiGo launched this gender-specific seating option in May 2024 as a pilot project, aimed at increasing the comfort and security of women travellers.

Government approves Rs 3,300 crore semiconductor unit in Gujarat's SanandThis unit represents India's fifth semiconductor facility and is part of the India Semiconductor Mission (ISM) to build a robust semiconductor ecosystem.

Union Cabinet approves Rs 13,966 crore boost for agriculture, food securityThe decision was made during a meeting chaired by Prime Minister Narendra Modi, with the goal of supporting farming activities and improving the lives of farmers.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Bengal anti-rape bill tabled, chaos as Mamata Banerjee lists rapes in BJP statesTitled the 'Aparajita Woman and Child Bill (West Bengal Criminal Laws and Amendment) 2024,' the legislation aims to strengthen protection for women and children by revising and introducing new provisions related to rape and sexual offences.

Haryana student mistaken for cow smuggler, chased for 25 km, killedFive people, identified as cow vigilantes, were arrested on charges of killing a Class 12 student after mistaking him for a cattle smuggler in Faridabad.

In IC 814 Kandahar hijack, the mystery of black briefcase and two red bagsThough much has been written about the hijacking of Indian Airlines flight IC 814, there are several aspects of the 1999 Kandahar hijack that remain shrouded in mystery, especially the two red bags and a black briefcase that played a crucial role in the incident. What were in the briefcase and the bags?

Nasa reveals source of sound coming from Sunita Williams's StarlinerThe pulsing noises, which emanated from a speaker in Boeing's Starliner spacecraft, had sparked widespread speculation and concern over the weekend.

25% IIT-Bombay graduates fail to secure placement, minimum pay drops to Rs 4 LPAThe 2024 placement season at IIT-Bombay concluded with an average annual package of Rs 23.5 lakh. Only 75 percent of students who actively participated in the campus drive secured jobs, with 1,475 job offers accepted. This marks a decline from last year's 82 percent placement rate.

Did Biren Singh speak too soon and invite Manipur storm?There's a fresh storm in Manipur after a period of lull. This comes within days of Chief Minister N Biren Singh pointing out that ethnic clashes were on the wane and permanent peace could be achieved in six months. Is it something specific that Singh said which infuriated the Kukis, or is there a "larger interest" at play?

Sathyabama welcomes the Yorker Champion Jasprit BumrahIn a memorable event, Sathyabama University had the honour of hosting one of India's most celebrated cricket icons, Mr. Jasprit Bumrah. The university's President, Dr. Marie Johnson, and Chancellor, Dr. Mariazeena Johnson, warmly welcomed the champion fast bowler, renowned for his impeccable yorkers, to the campus.

The atmosphere was electric as students gathered in large numbers, eager to catch a glimpse of the cricket sensation. Their excitement and enthusiasm were palpable, reflecting the immense respect and admiration they hold for Bumrah. His visit not only inspired the students but also created an unforgettable experience, further strengthening the bond between sports and academia at Sathyabama University.
IIM professor defends Navya Nanda's admission, calls it purely merit-basedNavya Nanda's admission to IIM Ahmedabad has sparked online criticism, but an IIM professor has defended her merit.

Indian woman's family performs last rites at Malaysia sinkhole she fell intoVijaya Lakshmi Gali from Andhra Pradesh, visiting Malaysia on holiday, fell into a 26-feet-deep sinkhole in Kuala Lumpur on August 23 and has remained missing since.

Mumbai entrepreneur, 25, hospitalised after adopting 'hustle culture'. Full storyA Mumbai-based entrepreneur, Kritarth Mittal, was hospitalised after he adopted a relentless work schedule and a poor lifestyle.

Tracing Navya Naveli's journeyNavya Naveli Nanda's entry into IIM Ahmedabad's blended postgraduate programme spotlights a new way of learning for working professionals with more explained opportunities. Relief for 2 lakh UP government employees, 'declare assets' deadline extendedThe Uttar Pradesh government has taken a stern stance against non-compliance by state employees regarding asset declaration. More than 2.44 lakh state government employees who failed to submit their asset details have been given a deadline to comply.
Audi boss falls 10,000 feet while climbing mountain in Italy, diesFabrizio Longo, 62, was an avid mountain climber and had been the Director of Audi Italy since 2013, according to reports.

Nadal sides with Sinner amid doping row, says 'justice is justice'Rafael Nadal defended Jannik Sinner, expressing trust in the verdict clearing him of intentional doping. Despite controversy, Sinner's US Open run continues strong, with a Round of 16 clash against Tommy Paul on September 3.

Yogesh Kathuniya won silver in the Men's discus throw F56 event.

Sumit Antil defends Paralympics gold with record-breaking throwRecord-breaker Sumit Antil made it back-to-back gold medals at the Paralympics with a sensational performance in Paris on September 2, Monday.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
